attributes.action: Stop new cars being  fitted with 'spy in the car' black box that will track your every move.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Drivers face having their every move tracked by a 'spy in the car' black box. The system will constantly check a vehicle's speed - making cameras redundant - and allow for pay-as-you-go tolls. The £36million EU project is partly funded by the UK Government and backed by car makers and the telecoms industry. It will be unveiled later this year with a view to its integration into future cars. Manufacturers suggest this could be as early as 2013.Vehicles fitted with the system will emit a constant 'heartbeat' pulse revealing their location, speed and direction of travel,civil liberties campaigners say it will have profound implications for privacy by creating a Europe-wide system of Big Brother surveillance. The European Commission has already asked governments to reserve a radio frequency for the system to operate on.
